action.action-desc: Mr. Marchant introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify S corporation shareholder and preferred stock rules with respect to banks.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Capital Access for Small Business Banks Act.

section.header: S corporation banks permitted to have 500 shareholders

subsection.text: Section 1361(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: In the case of a bank (as defined in section 581) or a depository institution holding company (as defined in section 3(w)(1) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813(w)(1))), subsection (b)(1)(A) shall be applied by substituting 500 shareholders for 100 shareholders.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017.

section.header: Bank issuance of preferred stock permitted

subsection.text: Section 1361 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Treatment of Qualified Preferred Bank Stock

paragraph.text: Qualified preferred bank stock shall not be taken into account as outstanding stock of the S corporation for purposes of this subchapter (other than subsection (b)(1)(A) and section 1368(g)).
For purposes of this subsection, the term qualified preferred bank stock means stock which—

subparagraph.text: is issued by a bank (as defined in section 581) or a depository institution holding company (as defined in section 3(w)(1) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1813(w)(1))),
is not held by a person ineligible under subsection (b)(1) to be a shareholder of a small business corporation, and
meets the requirements of subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C) of section 1504(a)(4).

subsection.header: Distributions includible in shareholder gross income and deductible by S corporation
subsection.text: Section 1368 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
If a shareholder receives a distribution (not in part or full payment in exchange for stock) from an S corporation with respect to any qualified preferred bank stock (as defined in section 1361(h))—

paragraph.text: the amount of such distribution shall be includible in gross income of the shareholder, and

there shall be allowed as a deduction by the corporation for the taxable year of such corporation in which or with which ends the taxable year in which such amount is included in the gross income of the shareholder an amount equal to the amount which bears the same ratio to the amount of such distribution as—

subparagraph.text: the highest rate of tax in effect for the taxable year with respect to individuals for qualified dividend income (as defined in section 1(h)(11)), over
the highest rate of tax in effect for the taxable year with respect to individuals under subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d) of section 1 (after the application of subsection (i) thereof).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017.
